text: @ Czech republic. Appearance: pours clear amber with ok short lived off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, straw, light caramel and some floral notes. palette: medium malty aroma, average carbonation, medium body, average malt sweetness, somewhat balanced by a light to medium bitterness, average duration and a watery texture. Overall: quite ok amber lager.
On tap at brewery. Pours dark golden color, white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, cherries. Taste is medium sweet, caramel, cherries, dark berries.
Hazy light brown coulour with almost no head. Caramel and hopps in aroma. Medium light body with lower carbonation. Balance between caramel maltines and bitterness. Drinkable

Darker amber body, light hazy, medium white frosty head. Aroma has burn caramel notes, toffee with light butter. Pretty complex. Taste is high honey sweet, light to medium grassy bitterness. Body is medium with high caramel.

Szép, borostyán vörös színe van, habja világos bézs színű, elég termetes, dunnás és közepesen kitartó. Illata és íze karamellás, igen malátás, mézes, de ezekhez az édes jegyekhez hozzá csatlakozik egy szép adag virágos, szénás és zöldséges komló is. Könnyű, de nem vizes és elég buborékos. Utóíze keserédes, karamellás, kissé száraz. Nem rossz...
Pours a medium brown colour. Aroma is quite herbal. Its very sweet and quite floral. Bubblegum finish. Strange.

En fût. Pinte dégustée directement à la brasserie. Arôme: Légère odeur de caramel. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de céréales grillées avec une pointe fruitée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement crémeuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de céréales grillées en arrière goût. (Rating #4831)
Velmi pitelný speciál, troku karamelová chuť, ale ne moc, přesně tak jak to mám rád. Lahváč z pivoňky.
Pours dark amber with a beige head. Aroma is toffee, butter and light nuts. Flavour is caramel, butter, nuts and pine.

On tap at the restaurant (03/03/13). Rather clear amber pour, thick foamy white head. Aroma is caramel forward, as with the svetle but it somehow seems more fitting here, classic fruity and vanilla polotmavé notes as well. Taste of caramel, light toasted grain, light fruitiness, delicate. Palate is fluffy, definitely not one of the driest examples, but well attenuated nonetheless. Good.

My Bottom Line:
Vanilla, caramel and butterscotch seep from this Polotmavys pleasant malts.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy head of foam covers the hazy dark amber.
-This one too feels like it was carbonated with a dose of nitrogen.
-This Polotmavys quite low on the hops.
-There isnt much depth here, but the flavor profile is highly pleasant.
-Mouthfeel is silky and creamy.

On tap at the brewpub.

Live rating: 330ml bottle from a friend returning to England from Prague. Pours hazy amber with yellowish white thick head. Yeasty and mildly hoppy aroma with wood and savoury scents. Intensely sour citric tastes in-the-mouth; lemon/unripe fruit. Sweet-sour, primarily acidic finish on medium body and lightly zingy mouthfeel. Tingling sensation on the tongue for several moments between sips. Something of an effort needed to drink. I noticed on the bottle the following: Minimalni trvanlivost do 10.12.12. Does this mean it was two weeks past its drink-by date????
Bottle @ End of the year, Odense Tasting 2012. Pours clear amber with a off white head.  Nose is toffee and berries. Flavor likewise. Sweet and buttery. Thin and flat.
Its not really a Christmas Tasting in Odense. Copper with a small white head. Aroma of toffee with a touch of apple peel and some diacetyl. Sweet malty flavour with diacetyl
Brown red color with no head at all. Aroma of caramel, spices. Taste is watery with some clove and a bit bitterness. I didnt enjoy it that much

On draught at the brewery tap / restaurant, so in optimum condition.  A classic Czech Polotmavy take on Vienna Lager, if such a style ever really existed.  Easily mistakable in palate for a north of England stronger bitter.  Dabs of caramel, a bit of barley sugar and enough hop to keep it from cloying.
Draught at BBF12. Buttery aroma. Clear dark brown colour. Small tan head. The flavour is sweet and sugary with a hint of butter. Low to medium bitterness.

Bottle.  Cracker and some caramel in the nose, faint fruit and dough.  Dark orange-amber with a rocky tan head.  Taste is moderately dry, some cracker and bread, slight citrus, medium body.  Some vegetal/spice notes I dont like.

On tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Medium dark amber colour, medium off-white head. Aroma caramel, fruity, Taste medium sweet, light bitter with somd tartness. A bit alcoholey. Apples. Finish tart-bitter, low drinkability.

Tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Dark amber color with huge white head. Aroma of roasted malt, berries, butterscotch. Taste, toffee, milk chocolate, hints of coffee. Light bitterness in finish. Drinkable beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Another Czech beer that's milky sweet on the nose - interesting regional flavor profile. Same on the flavor. Though this one has some malt sweetness, and is slightly bitter on the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.33 bottle from Pivkupectví/Zly Casy. Hazypale  amber-chestnut colour, small off-white head. Malty base with lovely roast flavours, aromatic and bitter hops in the finish. Well balanced and quite roasty.

on tap at klub malych pivovaru in pilsen. another well-crafted brew from this exciting new brewery - rich shade of amber with a firm and lasting off-white head; aroma of red berry and pancake dough; juicy malt character and a quick and dry finish that leaves you wanting more. might almost be worth a trip to the dump that is jihlava
